text:
taskdefs.AvailableTest, test 21 fails on NetWare.  It is trying to parse the 
XML attr - "classpath="${java.home}/lib/rt.jar:${java.home}/lib/classes.zip" 
(which is expanded to SYS:\JAVA/lib/rt.jar:SYS:\JAVA/lib/classes.zip)  It looks 
like this is a scenario that my parsing code in PathTokenizer doesn't take into 
account.  Even though PathTest.java tests a fairly extensive set of scenarios, 
it did not test this exact type of string.   I have the fix and some more 
PathTest.java enhancements that I will attach to this bug report.

Created attachment 1766
PathTokenizer fix - parsing ":" path separators on the NetWare OS
creator: jtulley@novell.com
jtulley@novell.com
text:
Created attachment 1767
Test code that exposed the PathTokenizer bug directly

I have one huge caveat on the PathTest.java patch that I have attached.  That 
is that I have not executed the test code on a UNIX environment, and I am not 
sure at all if the "correct" behavior that I assert for is really how it will 
and should be on UNIX.  For the Windows platform I put what asserts I thought 
should be there, and then ended up being quite wrong.  After analyzing the 
behavior there, I decided it works as designed and is probably ok.  Maybe there 
should be the "isUnixStyle" case in the committed code until I(or somebody 
else) has the chance to possibly adjust the assertions there to reality.

Once again, the PathTokenizer fix is in NetWare executing code only, so should 
not affect other platforms.  Hopefully low risk despite being in such core code.
